source.157029ba:
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
df = pd.read_csv("../input/students-performance-in-exams/StudentsPerformance.csv")
df.head(10).style.set_properties(**{'background-color': 'black',                                                   
                                    'color': 'lawngreen',                       
                                    'border-color': 'white'})
source.13f6c492:
from sklearn.preprocessing import LabelEncoder

for c in df.columns:
    if df[c].dtype=='object': 
        lbl = LabelEncoder()
        lbl.fit(list(df[c].values))
        df[c] = lbl.transform(df[c].values)
        
df.head(10).style.background_gradient(cmap = 'hot')
source.fd962111:
import seaborn as sns
sns.set_theme(style="darkgrid")



# Plot the responses for different events and regions
sns.lineplot(x="math score", y="reading score",
              hue="gender",
             data=df)

source.c1a77cbe:
Parental level of education

0 ---> associate's degree

1 ---> bachelor's degree

2 ---> high school

3 ---> master's degree

4 ---> some college

5 ---> some high school

Gender

0 ---> female

1 ---> male
source.1d028c1f: “Education is the passport to the future, for tomorrow belongs to those who prepare for it today.” — Malcolm X
source.93ca4b31: 4) Reading, writing and math scores is found to be more where parental level of education is some college and lowest where parental level of education is master's degree.
source.1b7287cc:
1) Female are ahead of male in reading and writing scores, but in math scores male is higher than female.

2) Meal is important, hence if we look closely when lunch is provided math score is comparatively higher than lunch is absent.

3) Reading, writing, math score is found to be more in race/ethnicity group C and lowest in race/ethnicity group A.

4) Surprisingly, reading, writing and math scores is found to be more where parental level of education is some college and lowest where parental level of education is master's degree.
source.8c079ac3: Reading scores based on parental level of education and race/ethnicity, For female reading score is comparatively higher than male in all aspects of parental level of education.
source.5e6d8829: ECDF plots of writing score with respect to race/ethnicity and gender
source.b1c6b7de: Math scores based on parental level of education and race/ethnicity, For male math score is comparatively higher than female, an exception can be seen in when parental level of education is 3(master's degree) with race/ethnicity is 1(group B) where math scores of female is much higher than male.
